column2: The King's Peace determines to what extent de jure vassals can wage war inside and outside the realm.
Vassals are able to wage war freely inside and outside the realm.
Vassals are unable to wage war against other characters in the realm, but can still wage war against other realms.
Vassals are unable to wage war against other characters in the realm or other realms.
Revokation refers to the King's ability to revoke a vassal's title.
The King is unable to revoke any titles.
The King is able to revoke titles, although his vassals will be upset if he has no valid reason.
There were big differences in the lifestyles of the ancient peoples. The people on the Steppe preferred a nomadic lifestyle while the 'civilised' world preferred an agricultural lifestyle.
These people follow a nomadic lifestyle. They live on the land until it can no longer sustain them. They prefer pastoralism, so they have to move around with their herds of livestock.
These people follow a settled lifestyle. They practice agriculture so they don't have to move around the land like the nomads do.
Feudal Emphasis changes the focus of the nobility.
The nobility will provide a lot more levies in exchange for a large reduction in taxes.

The nobility will provide more taxes in exchange for a reduction in levies.
The nobility will provide a lot more taxes in exchange for a large reduction in levies.
Feudal Obligations changes the obligations of the nobility.
The nobility has a low amount of obligations.
The nobility has a moderate amount of obligations.
The nobility has a high amount of obligations.
The nobility has a harsh amount of obligations.
